sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"脏的，污秽的"之意。
means: dirty ： 普通用词，泛指被玷污或弄脏。
foul ： 指由于腐烂、恶臭等造成的不干净，令人恶心。
nasty ： 主要指特别讲究清洁的人感到讨厌的东西。

sentence.Network_en: A series of technical foul-ups delayed the launch of the new product.
sentence.Network_cn: 一系列技术问题延误了新产品的上市。

sentence.Network_en: Collins was in a foul mood even before the interviews began.
sentence.Network_cn: 柯林斯在采访还没开始时就暴躁不安起来。

sentence.Network_en: One of the judges thought it was a foul throw.
sentence.Network_cn: 有个裁判认为投球犯规.

jx.jx_en_mean: do something damaging or harmful to oneself or one's own interests
jx.jx_cn_mean: 破坏（或伤害）自己（或自己的利益）

phrase.cizu_name: foul something up ( 或 foul up)

jx.jx_en_mean: make a mistake with or spoil something

lj.lj_ly: leaders should admit when they completely foul things up.
lj.lj_ls: 领导人把事情完全搞糟时应该自己承认。

jx.jx_en_mean: &I{Sports} To be put out of a game for exceeding the number of permissible fouls.
jx.jx_cn_mean: &I{【体育运动】} 因犯规超过规定次数被罚下场

jx.jx_en_mean: To blunder or cause to blunder because of mistakes or poor judgment.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 因错误或粗心而犯大错

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English fūl, of Germanic origin; related to Old Norse fúll 'foul', Dutch vuil 'dirty', and German faul 'rotten, lazy', from an Indo-European root shared by Latin pus, Greek puos 'pus', and Latin putere 'to stink'

entry.def: If you describe something as foul, you mean it is dirty and smells or tastes unpleasant.
Foul language is offensive and contains swear words or rude words.

example.ex: He was sent off for using foul language in a match last Sunday...
example.tran: 他在上周日的一场比赛中因为骂人而被罚下场。

entry.def: If someone has a foul temper or is in a foul mood, they become angry or violent very suddenly and easily.

example.ex: Collins was in a foul mood even before the interviews began.
example.tran: 柯林斯在采访还没开始时就暴躁不安起来。

entry.tran: (天气)恶劣的，多风的，有暴风雨的
entry.def: Foul weather is unpleasant, windy, and stormy.
If a place is fouled by someone or something, they make it dirty.

example.ex: A village's entire beach and harbor can be fouled by a single rotting whale...
example.tran: 一只腐烂的死鲸就足以弄脏一个村子的整片海滩和港口。

example.ex: Two oil-related accidents near Los Angeles have fouled the ocean and the skies there.
example.tran: 发生在洛杉矶附近的两起漏油事故已经污染了那里的海洋和天空。

entry.def: If an animal fouls a place, it drops faeces onto the ground.

example.ex: It is an offence to let your dog foul a footpath.
example.tran: 让狗在人行道上拉屎是违法行为。

entry.def: If a machine or vehicle fouls part of its mechanism or if something such as a rope fouls the mechanism, the mechanism can no longer work properly because something has become twisted or knotted around it.

example.ex: The freighter fouled its propeller in fishing nets.
example.tran: 货船的螺旋桨被渔网缠住了。

entry.def: In a game or sport, if a player fouls another player, they touch them or block them in a way which is not allowed according to the rules.

example.ex: Middlesbrough's Jimmy Phillips was sent off for fouling Steve Tilson.
example.tran: 米德尔斯堡队的吉米·菲利普斯因为对史蒂夫·蒂尔森犯规而被罚下场。

entry.def: A foul is an act in a game or sport that is not allowed according to the rules.

example.ex: He picked up his first booking for a 45th-minute foul on Bull.
example.tran: 他因为在比赛进行到第 45 分钟时对公牛队犯规而被第一次记名警告。

entry.tran: 声明对手犯规;声称对手违法
entry.def: If you cry foul, you claim that someone, especially an opponent or rival, has acted illegally or unfairly.

example.ex: Deprived of the crushing victory it was confidently expecting, the party cried foul.
example.tran: 失去了自以为十拿九稳的压倒性胜利，该政党声称对手违规。

entry.tran: 不择手段地;采取一切手段地
entry.def: If someone tries to achieve something by fair means or foul, they use every means possible in order to achieve it, and they do not care if their behaviour is dishonest or unfair.

example.ex: They will only be satisfied if they regain control —by fair means or foul.
example.tran: 只有重新掌权他们才会满意——为此他们将不择手段。

entry.def: If you fall foul of someone or run foul of them, you do something which gets you into trouble with them.

example.ex: He had fallen foul of the FBI.
example.tran: 他已经惹恼了联邦调查局。

example.ex: ...teenagers who run foul of the law.

entry.def: If you foul up something such as a plan, you spoil it by doing something wrong or stupid.

example.ex: There are serious risks that laboratories may foul up these tests.
example.tran: 实验室很有可能搞砸这些试验。

means.word_mean: 1. an act that violates of the rules of a sport
3. become or cause to become obstructed;

sentences.sentence: "The leaves clog our drains in the Fall"

means.word_mean: 4. commit a foul; break the rules

sentences.sentence: "The townspeople defiled the river by emptying raw sewage into it"

means.word_mean: 1. highly offensive; arousing aversion or disgust;

sentences.sentence: "the idea of eating meat is repellent to me"

means.word_mean: 4. (of a baseball) not hit between the foul lines

sentences.sentence: "filthy (or foul or nasty or vile) weather we're having"

means.word_mean: 8. disgustingly dirty; filled or smeared with offensive matter;
9. especially of a ship's lines etc;

sentences.en: The house was filled with foul odour.
sentences.cn: 房间里充满了难闻的气味。

means.word_mean: 令人不愉快的, 糟透了的

sentences.en: I've had a foul morning; everything's gone wrong.
sentences.cn: 我今天早上很不愉快, 事事不对劲。

sentences.en: Take off those foul clothes and let me wash them.
sentences.cn: 脱下那些脏衣服让我洗一洗。

sentences.en: Many were shocked by his foul language.
sentences.cn: 许多人对他那下流的语言感到震惊。

means.word_mean: 恶劣的; 有暴风雨的

sentences.en: What a foul day it is!

means.word_mean: 邪恶的, 罪恶的,；不道德的；残忍的

sentences.cn: 谋杀是件非常丑恶的事。

sentences.en: The rope fouled the anchor chain.

sentences.cn: 那个足球运动员试图犯规。

sentences.en: He was sent off for fouling the other team's goalkeeper.
sentences.cn: 他因对对方守门员犯规而被罚出场。

sentences.en: The player was sent off the field because of fouls.
sentences.cn: 这名运动员因屡屡犯规而被罚下场。
